title: Toddler's shooting death ruled accidental
content:
The Elkhart County Prosecutor's office has concluded that no charges will be filed in the Nov. 20, 2014 shooting that resulted in the death of an Elkhart toddler.
Prosecutor Curtis T. Hill said in a statement that Jeremiah Ross, 3, died of an accidental self-inflicted gunshot wound suffered when a 9 mm handgun left in the master bedroom of his home discharged. The boy was in the bedroom with his mother, who left the room momentarily. She reported hearing a popping sound and returned to the bedroom and found that the child had been wounded. Hill said that, based on evidence gathered by the Elkhart police department, the weapon accidentally discharged while the boy was handling it.
The gun was legally owned by the boy's father, who was not at home at the time of the accident. Hill reminded gun owners to make sure that weapons are properly secured so that they cannot be accessed by children.
